column1: Of the following six triumvirs, how many died of natural causes?
Which Roman general held the office of consul an unprecedented seven times?
Who was known as the Second Founder of Rome?
Who created the first ever Roman fire brigade?
Which two cities did Rome completely destroy and raze in 146 BCE?
What senator would end every speech with the phrase "Carthage must be destroyed"?
What Greek historian and former slave was the tutor of a young Scipio Aemilianus, the future hero of the Third Punic War (149-146 BCE)?

Which Roman general initiated reforms to the army, such as opening its ranks to landless citizens, that led to the professionalism of its military for the first time in its history and inexorably led to the civil wars of the first century BCE?

A young Julius Caesar was rumored to have had a romantic relationship with the King of Bithynia, a kingdom and Roman province in the northwest of present-day Turkey.  Despite his vehement denials, these rumors dogged him for the rest of his life.  Who was the king?
